title: MA-WASTE Data Updates - Current as of February 2026

outmigration.source: US Census Bureau V2025 estimates, released January 2026
keyUpdates: Total population growth: only 15,524 - lowest since 2021
MA ranked 5th worst for outmigration (behind NY, NJ, IL, CA)
outmigration.quote: Absent immigration, Massachusetts would already be losing population. Domestic out-migration rose again in 2025.

energyCosts.currentRate: 29.94 to 34 cents per kWh (varies by source/provider)
energyCosts.note: Rate varies by provider due to deregulated market; all sources confirm MA among highest in nation

housingPrices.affordabilityNote: In 2015, 57 municipalities had median prices below $500k. By 2025, only 3 remain: Brockton, Halifax, Wareham

taxBurden.propertyTaxSource: MA DLS FY2026 Tax Levies report (January 2026)
taxBurden.note: 343 of 351 communities have FY2026 tax rates set as of Jan 1, 2026
taxBurden.totalLevyGrowth: Levies continue to grow; commercial values in Boston and Cambridge decreased
taxBurden.stateRanking: Tax Foundation 2025: 9th worst (42nd of 50) for overall tax competitiveness

shelterCrisis.auditFindings: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio 74-page report, May 2025
shelterCrisis.healeyResponse: I doubt it. This has been territory pretty well covered.

propertyTaxByTown.description: MA DLS Gateway - Tax Rates by Class for all 351 municipalities
propertyTaxByTown.dataAvailable: FY2026 rates, average single family tax bills, tax rates by class

averageTaxBillByTown.description: Average Single Family Tax Bill report - ranked by town

populationByTown.description: Census Bureau estimates for all 351 cities/towns through July 2024
